source.author: Short, P.S.
source.title: Argentipallium
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Short, P.S. (1999). Argentipallium. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Leaves concolorous, surfaces densely white- to grey-cottony
Leaf surfaces discolorous with upper surface glabrous to sparsely cottony
Rhizomatous, somewhat tufted herbs branched only from base; leaf apices commonly acute; lamina of involucral bracts white or purplish
Non-rhizomatous herbs, branching at and above the base; leaf apices commonly obtuse; lamina of involucral bracts white
